content.description: Sit start at the arete with edges. From there, gain a right hand hueco, follow to a good left hand incut edge, make a big move to the lip, and pull on top of the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there are some rocks in it.
content.location: It climbs the east side of Capitulation's southeast arete.

content.description:
Sit start with a great left hand ball-edge and a right hand sloping-pinch. From there, place a right heel hook, gain a big right hand jug, bump the left hand up along the arete, gain a good left hand jug at the lip, then commit to the gnarled mess of a slab, and top it out.

Be cautious with the holds on the slab. Many of the holds are brittle and will require more traffic to clean it up.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but the hill does slope away behind it.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Capitulation.

content.description: Sit start at the arete on bumps. From there, follow the arete through the bumps, gain a left hand edge on the face, walk the feet over to the platform, bump higher with the left hand to a crimp, slap a right hand up to a sidepull, then follow to another diagonal edge above, gain the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: Pair of pads will work well. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the south facing arete of Capitulation.
